byline.original: By NICHOLAS FANDOS and STEVEN LEE MYERS

abstract: Washington, DC, chief medical examiner says former Russian cabinet minister Mikhail Y Lesin died of blunt force head trauma, contradicting Russian media's claim that he was victim of heart attack; Lesin, former state media executive whose vast wealth was under scrutiny, had fallen out with Putin regime at time of his November 2015 death in Washington hotel room.
lead_paragraph: A medical examiner’s report, which found that Mr. Lesin had died of blunt force injuries in a Washington hotel, conflicted with Russian news reports that he had died of a heart attack.

headline.main: Mystery Deepens Over Death of Former Putin Ally Mikhail Lesin
headline.print_headline: Mystery Deepens Over Death of Former Putin Ally

snippet: A medical examiner’s report, which found that Mr. Lesin had died of blunt force injuries in a Washington hotel, conflicted with Russian news reports that he had died of a heart attack.
